parameters.name: AutoPublishRouteEnabled
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable the local Enterprise Edition transit router to automatically advertise the routes of the inter-region connection to the peer transit router. Valid values:

*   **false** (default): no
*   **true**: yes

parameters.name: Bandwidth
parameters.description:
The bandwidth value of the inter-region connection. Unit: Mbit/s.

*   This parameter specifies the maximum bandwidth value for the inter-region connection if you set **BandwidthType** to **BandwidthPackage**.
*   This parameter specifies the bandwidth throttling threshold for the inter-region connection if you set **BandwidthType** to **DataTransfer**.

parameters.name: BandwidthType
parameters.description:
The method that is used to allocate bandwidth to the inter-region connection. Valid values:

*   **BandwidthPackage**: allocates bandwidth from a bandwidth plan.
*   **DataTransfer**: bandwidth is billed based on the pay-by-data-transfer metering method.

parameters.name: CenBandwidthPackageId
parameters.description:
The ID of the bandwidth plan that you want to associate with the inter-region connection.

>  If you set **BandwidthType** to **DataTransfer**, you can skip this parameter.

parameters.name: CenId
parameters.description: The ID of the Cloud Enterprise Network (CEN) instance.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

>  If you do not specify this parameter, the system automatically uses the **request ID** as the **client token**. The **request ID** may be different for each request.

parameters.name: DefaultLinkType
parameters.description:
The default line type.

Valid values: Platinum and Gold.

Platinum is supported only when BandwidthType is set to DataTransfer.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform a dry run. Default values:

*   **false** (default): performs a dry run and sends the request.
*   **true**: performs a dry run. The system checks the required parameters and request syntax. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the system returns the ID of the request.

parameters.name: PeerTransitRouterId
parameters.description: The ID of the peer transit router.

parameters.name: PeerTransitRouterRegionId
parameters.description: The ID of the region where the peer transit router is deployed.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the region where the local Enterprise Edition transit router is deployed.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description:
The information about the tags.

You can specify at most 20 tags in each call.

parameters.name: TransitRouterAttachmentDescription
parameters.description:
The description of the inter-region connection.

This parameter is optional. If you enter a description, it must be 1 to 256 characters in length, and cannot start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: TransitRouterAttachmentName
parameters.description:
The name of the inter-region connection.

The name can be empty or 1 to 128 characters in length, and cannot start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: TransitRouterId
parameters.description: The ID of the local Enterprise Edition transit router.
